result.execSummary:
The defendant Karissa Anne McIntosh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Writings or Objects, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).
  • Forgery-Writings or Objects, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Must reside at 3801 Spruce Street Racine, WI. Comply with prenatal and postnatal care. Enroll in a parenting program. Set up a budget for independent living. Maintain a checking account if approved by agent. Psychological evaluation and follow through with recommendations.   Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Do not drive unless properly licensed.Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

timeConds.notes: Enroll in the Day Reporting Program. May not leave the home except for medical appointments, for school and work.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
for eligibility to participate in Day Reporting Center.

Defendant Karissa Anne McIntosh in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: For the defendant to enroll in Day Reporting the defendant needs to report to Racine County Jail and then Day Reporting will process her out that same day. Report to Racine County Jail on Thursday February 4, 2016 @ 10:00 am.

Defendant Karissa Anne McIntosh in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 

15CF1196
Ct 1- Withheld sentence, 3 years prob

Ct 4- Withheld sentence, 3 years prob

15CF1366
Ct 1- Withheld sentence, 3 years probabtion

Ct 2- -Withheld sentence, 3 years probation 


Conditions:
Reside at the home of her grandmother at 3801 Spruce Street Racine, WI 
For the first 90 days engage in the Day Reporting Program - may not leave the home except for medial appts, for school and work 
No drugs, no alcohol
Take all medications as prescribed
Comply with prenatal & postnatal care
Enroll in a parenting program
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,580.22 to Educators Credit Union
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,200.00 to her grandnother
Set up a budget for independent living
Maintain a checking account in her own name and must be approved with agaent
Psychological evaluation and follow thru with rec's - counsel and med as precsrived
FAW
VOTE
Do not drive unless properly licensed
Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation
Eli for CIP & ERP
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge 
Waive court costs

Defendant Karissa Anne McIntosh in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Requesting an adjournment as only received every other page of the PSI report.
BTC: Adj  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Karissa Anne McIntosh in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- In 15CF1196 Plea to count 1 & count 4; DRI the balance. In 15CF1366 Plea to count 1 & count 2; DRI the balance.
Rights Given
P- No Contest
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 & count 4 in 15CF1196; DRI the balance & count 1 & count 2 in 15CF1366; DRI the balance. PSI Ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  No violent contact with the victim, FAE (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Karissa Anne McIntosh in court with attorney Adrienne Michelle Moore.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
